trans-unit.source: Debug your Model in Azure Machine Learning | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Debug your Model in Azure Machine Learning | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how to How to debug your Model in Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to How to debug your Model in Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: Debug your Model in Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Debug your Model in Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: This article explains of how to debug your models in Microsoft Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: This article explains of how to debug your models in Microsoft Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, it covers the potential reasons why either of the following two failure scenarios might be encountered when running a model:
trans-unit.target: Specifically, it covers the potential reasons why either of the following two failure scenarios might be encountered when running a model:

trans-unit.source: the [Train Model][train-model] module throws an error
trans-unit.target: the [Train Model][train-model] module throws an error

trans-unit.source: the [Score Model][score-model] module produces incorrect results
trans-unit.target: the [Score Model][score-model] module produces incorrect results

trans-unit.source: Train Model Module throws an error
trans-unit.target: Train Model Module throws an error

trans-unit.source: image1
trans-unit.target: image1

trans-unit.source: The [Train Model][train-model] Module expects the following 2 inputs:
trans-unit.target: The [Train Model][train-model] Module expects the following 2 inputs:

trans-unit.source: The type of Classification/Regression Model from the collection of models provided by Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: The type of Classification/Regression Model from the collection of models provided by Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: The training data with a specified Label column.
trans-unit.target: The training data with a specified Label column.

trans-unit.source: The Label column specifies the variable to predict.
trans-unit.target: The Label column specifies the variable to predict.

trans-unit.source: The rest of the columns included are assumed to be Features.
trans-unit.target: The rest of the columns included are assumed to be Features.

trans-unit.source: This module throws an error in the following cases:
trans-unit.target: This module throws an error in the following cases:

trans-unit.source: The Label column is specified incorrectly because either more than one column is selected as the Label or an incorrect column index is selected.
trans-unit.target: The Label column is specified incorrectly because either more than one column is selected as the Label or an incorrect column index is selected.

trans-unit.source: For example, the second case would apply if a column index of 30 was used with an input dataset which had only 25 columns.
trans-unit.target: For example, the second case would apply if a column index of 30 was used with an input dataset which had only 25 columns.

trans-unit.source: The dataset does not contain any Feature columns.
trans-unit.target: The dataset does not contain any Feature columns.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the input dataset has only 1 column, which is marked as the Label column, there would be no features with which to build the model.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the input dataset has only 1 column, which is marked as the Label column, there would be no features with which to build the model.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the [Train Model][train-model] module will throw an error.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the [Train Model][train-model] module will throw an error.

trans-unit.source: The input dataset (Features or Label) contain Infinity as a value.
trans-unit.target: The input dataset (Features or Label) contain Infinity as a value.

trans-unit.source: Score Model Module does not produce correct results
trans-unit.target: Score Model Module does not produce correct results

trans-unit.source: image2
trans-unit.target: image2

trans-unit.source: In a typical training/testing graph for supervised learning, the [Split][split] module divides the original dataset into two parts: the part that is used to train the model and the part that is reserved to score how well the trained model performs on data it did not train on.
trans-unit.target: In a typical training/testing graph for supervised learning, the [Split][split] module divides the original dataset into two parts: the part that is used to train the model and the part that is reserved to score how well the trained model performs on data it did not train on.

trans-unit.source: The trained model is then used to score the test data after which the results are evaluated to determine the accuracy of the model.
trans-unit.target: The trained model is then used to score the test data after which the results are evaluated to determine the accuracy of the model.

trans-unit.source: The [Score Model][score-model] module requires two inputs:
trans-unit.target: The [Score Model][score-model] module requires two inputs:

trans-unit.source: A trained model output from [Train Model][train-model] module
trans-unit.target: A trained model output from [Train Model][train-model] module

trans-unit.source: A scoring dataset not that the model was not trained on
trans-unit.target: A scoring dataset not that the model was not trained on

trans-unit.source: It may happen that even though the experiment succeeds, the [Score Model][score-model] module produces incorrect results.
trans-unit.target: It may happen that even though the experiment succeeds, the [Score Model][score-model] module produces incorrect results.

trans-unit.source: Several scenarios may cause this to happen:
trans-unit.target: Several scenarios may cause this to happen:

trans-unit.source: If the specified Label is categorical and a regression model is trained on the data, an incorrect output would be produced by the [Score Model][score-model] module.
trans-unit.target: If the specified Label is categorical and a regression model is trained on the data, an incorrect output would be produced by the [Score Model][score-model] module.

trans-unit.source: This is because regression requires a continuous response variable.
trans-unit.target: This is because regression requires a continuous response variable.

trans-unit.source: In this case it should be more suitable to use a classification model.
trans-unit.target: In this case it should be more suitable to use a classification model.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, if a classification model is trained on a dataset having floating point numbers in the Label column, it may produce undesirable results.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, if a classification model is trained on a dataset having floating point numbers in the Label column, it may produce undesirable results.

trans-unit.source: This is because classification requires a discrete response variable that only allows values that range over a finite and usually somewhat small set of classes.
trans-unit.target: This is because classification requires a discrete response variable that only allows values that range over a finite and usually somewhat small set of classes.

trans-unit.source: If the scoring dataset does not contain all the features used to train the model, the [Score Model][score-model] will produce an error.
trans-unit.target: If the scoring dataset does not contain all the features used to train the model, the [Score Model][score-model] will produce an error.

trans-unit.source: The [Score Model][score-model] would not produce any output corresponding to a row in the scoring dataset that contains a missing value or an infinite value for any of its features.
trans-unit.target: The [Score Model][score-model] would not produce any output corresponding to a row in the scoring dataset that contains a missing value or an infinite value for any of its features.

trans-unit.source: The [Score Model][score-model] may produce identical outputs for all rows in the scoring dataset.
trans-unit.target: The [Score Model][score-model] may produce identical outputs for all rows in the scoring dataset.

trans-unit.source: This could occur, for example, in the when attempting classification using Decision Forests if the minimum number of samples per leaf node is chosen to be more than the number of training examples available.
trans-unit.target: This could occur, for example, in the when attempting classification using Decision Forests if the minimum number of samples per leaf node is chosen to be more than the number of training examples available.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
